page.title: 09ADDIEWELL CHURCH CENTENARY
page.content: The members of{Addiewell Parish } Church will never forget 1985. The church was{one hundred years old}that year and many celebrations took place. However the year will also be remembered because the joint parish of Addiewell and West Calder became no more with West Calder becoming a separate parish. Addiewell has now merged with Stoneyburn, Breich and Longridge. At the moment the new parish does not have a minister but the vacancy has been advertised and should be filled soon. Going back to the centenary, many events took place. For many the highlight was the visit to the church by Lord McLeod of Fuinary, one of the most respected members of the Church of Scotland. Addiewell Primary School held a very succesful Thanksgiving Service.
